summary: Ambitious professional focused on communications and customer service, with internships and hands-on experience in human resources, public relations, event planning, research, and HRIS databases; proven ability to manage schedules, coordinate travel, and maintain confidentiality in fast-paced environments.

experience.title: Human Resources Administrative Assistant/Executive Assistant
experience.description: Managed multiple schedules; assisted entire department with any and all needs; strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask; worked in a fast-paced environment; troubleshoot; high volume of interaction with accounting; coordinated travel arrangements; experience with confidential and sensitive information, employee relations; ensured compliance with labor law posters; tracked employee anniversaries; strong customer service skills; member of Winn Event Planning Committee; working knowledge of Learning Management System and training; facilitated WinnStart process.

experience.title: Street Team Member
experience.description: Responsible for setup, execution, and breakdown of station appearances; represented the station in a positive manner; maintained station vehicle and prize inventory; interacted with clients at sales appearances; upheld appropriate station image at all events (brand ambassador); communicated with Promotion Coordinator before and after events.

experience.title: Manager
experience.description: Promoted 4 times within 4 years of employment due to leadership abilities and work ethic; mentored/trained new members of staff in both event planning and cleaning; assisted with event coordination and troubleshoot problems while maintaining strong customer service focus.

experience.title: Communications Intern
experience.description: Assisted in the planning and execution of reunions and Alumni Mentor Networking Night events; contacted venues; utilized resourcefulness to decorate events and plan activities; conducted research to improve alumni website and magazine; generated ideas and conducted research to increase student attendance; created methods to reach out to alumni to encourage contributions and involvement.

experience.title: Public Relations Intern
experience.description: Wrote press releases promoting upcoming events for clients; composed/published blogs about public relations tips and current events; kept client websites, Facebook, and Twitter accounts up to date; made pitch calls to magazines; managed a Virginia political news blog, website, and social media pages; set up Google Alerts/Trapit to track information; attended rallies; coordinated and performed social media tasks for clients' events; employed effective communication strategies.

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Communication, Public Corporate Communication, Political Science

education.school: The Washington Center for Internships and Academic Seminars
